It’s a fair bet that the Japanese yen ğŸ’´ will continue dropping over the next half a year so you might as well holiday in Japan this summer. Whether it’s summer or winter â„ï¸ Japan is always a great place to relax. I enjoy going to the annual winter carnival ğŸ¡ where I go on the thrill rides ğŸ¢and eat pancakes ğŸ¥ and sushi ğŸ£ soaking up the nice Christmassy atmosphere. It’s been dazzlingly hot all week. You might just as well have a good long soak in an outdoor onsen soaking up the sun â˜€ï¸ In fact I’ve just got out of an onsen and am drying myself on a towel ğŸ˜Š I highly recommend Ramen Menya in Shinjuku. They provide a range of broths to please sophisticated palates including chicken broth, fish broth, pork bone broth, miso broth and lastly spicy broth. The spicy broth is toned down to suit the palates of the tourists do you don’t have to worry about it being too spicy ğŸŒ¶ Of course they too serve food ğŸ¥˜ adapted for their own palate. The richness of broth is perfect that can tempt demanding palates. The noodle texture is outstanding which will please the most refined palate. I remember the table was very sticky maybe because the staff forgot to wipe it up so I asked them to wipe it up. Then I spilled a bowl of miso soup all over my work and down my tie so I had to wipe up this messğŸ¤£ I also saw a baseball match at Tokyo Dome Stadium ğŸŸ where I bet heavily on the result of the match. It was unforgettable. Though baseball isn’t very popular in Hong Kong an increase in the promotion and marketing of the sport is offsetting this issue. I remember I spent money on clothes and shoes like it was going out of fashion. I entered a casino ğŸ° and gambled like it was going out of fashion. If you enjoy being in Japan you might spend money on food and cosmetic products like it’s going out of fashion. If you enter a casino you might gamble like it’s going out of fashion. Again, vacationing in Japan ğŸ‡¯ğŸ‡µ this summer is a good bet since the yen ğŸ’´ has fallen dramatically over the last five months. Remember to share your photos here !

I recommend climbing Mount Fuji ğŸ—» even though you’re outside Tokyo. The extra cost of traveling there is offset by the falling admission charge. It’s an arduous climb but the view is worth it. In fact my friend who’s just been there showed me his photos taken there by which I was awestruck. At night the nearby lakes reflects the beauty of the stars âœ¨ and Mount Fuji giving a double view of the starry sky and the mountains. The outline of Mount Fuji is clearly defined against the starry nights by which you’ll be awestruck. Again, cheap entrance fee offsets the rising transportation fees so it’s worth a visit. Several years ago I saw X Japan at Saitama Super Arena which was absolutely incredible and unforgettable. They’ve been strutting their stuff since they were kids. Even though they’re past their prime they’re still incredible musicians so don’t sell them short ! At the end of the last encore they bowed onstage soaking up the applause ğŸ‘ğŸ» They were given a thunderous standing ovation. On top of being a great musician ğŸ‘¨ğŸ»‍ğŸ¤ the drummer of the band is also an avid runner ğŸƒğŸ» A few years ago he took part in a five hundred and fifty metre race where he came first. He rose to the challenge of passing the runner ğŸƒğŸ» who was ahead of him earlier, ran for all he was worth and dived over the finish line ğŸ Lots of fans congratulated him for winning the race  as he held up his trophy ğŸ† The race was the opportunity for all the best runners ğŸƒğŸ» in japan to strut their stuff. It was truly memorable. Last month I took the JLPT at N two level in Tokyo in which I got a merit. My listening outshines my reading so the marks I gained in listening offset the marks I lost in reading. My friend too took the test at N three level. She’s a little weak at reading but strong in writing so the marks he lost in the reading part was offset by the marks she gained in the writing section. We were pleased with our results. Last week my Japanese friend Keita asked if I wanted to join him for supper so I said in the affirmative. Since we’re both Marvel fans we went to the cinema ğŸ¬the next day and joined the queue for the movie tickets for AvengersğŸHis friends joined us later for the movie ğŸ¥ That evening we joined his brother on a run ğŸƒğŸ» along the promenade. After that we went to his home ğŸ  and joined with his sister in doing a forty three thousand and two hundred piece jigsaw puzzle. It was very relaxing and enjoyable !

I work at Hotel JAP Tokyo. My friend Alan received a commission for a sculpture, a sketch and an oil painting ğŸ–¼ from the hotel. I congratulated him on having been commissioned to make a sculpture, make a sketch and paint an oil painting for the hotel since it’s a rare opportunity. Another friend of mine who’s a marketer at the hotel has recently been promoted and assigned to the headquarter in Hokkaido with which she’s really pleased. I’m very pleased about her promotion too. There’s a pageant in Osaka which I can’t wait to see. The final round will take place next month. Rosie seems extremely likely to enter the final round I would say. My friend Alex has got a commission to compose a waltz for the pageant because one of the contestants will be showcasing her waltz dance ğŸ’ƒğŸ» during the show which we all can’t wait to see. I congratulated him on having received a commission for a waltz as it’s a once in a lifetime opportunity. I too congratulated my friend Sarah on progressing through the first round. She’s a contestant in the beauty contest and I won’t be surprised if she progresses through the semifinal. I remember a decade ago in Tokyo, there was a protest where the protestors clashed with the police at a shopping mall. I saw it on the news. I thought the police weren’t tough enough. All the riot police were holding a shield with one hand and a truncheon with the other hand. In this way you can’t really fight the demonstrators and arrest them since you have no free hands to grab hold of them. That’s why it took four policemen to get hold of one protestor. From a fighting angle, some of the riot police should be holding both a nightstick and a shield, some holding just a shield, the other just a truncheon. And all of them should’ve been trained as to how they fight when they’re holding both a truncheon and a shield, holding just a shield and holding just a nightstick. Anyway if you happen to be staying at Hotel JAP Tokyo, please remember the following as I work there ğŸ˜Š: First, before washing your clothes please remove tissue and coins from the pockets and put only seventy percent of the dirty clothes in the wash tub. This will ensure your clothes to get evenly clean and the machine will less likely be out of order. Second of all please don’t turn the air conditioner up to more than twenty five degrees Celsius. Otherwise it won’t blow cold air and will smell bad.
